title: Long - term Arsenal target could be available after growing unhappy at present club
body_text:
Ousmane Dembele has been an Arsenal target since his time at Barcelona, and the Frenchman continues to remain on their radar. His spell in Spain appeared to suggest that he had lost his way, yet that perception was challenged by his performances for Paris Saint-Germain last season. He re-established himself as a decisive figure and played a central role in a campaign that delivered the Champions League alongside several other major honours. His contribution was recognised with the Ballon d’Or, underlining his return to the highest level of the game.
At PSG, Dembele rediscovered confidence and consistency, qualities that suggested a long and productive relationship between player and club. He has become one of their most important performers, and given the financial strength of the Paris-based side, they are rarely under pressure to sell their leading players. This has generally limited opportunities for rival clubs to prise away key assets.
Arsenal interest and Dembele’s situation
Despite PSG’s strong position, a potential opening may be emerging. According to Football Transfers, Dembele has grown unhappy in Paris due to internal issues at the club. The report suggests that these problems have affected his satisfaction and have led to speculation that he could consider leaving. This development has placed Arsenal on alert, as they have monitored his situation for some time and could now look to revive their interest.
For Arsenal, the prospect of signing a player of Dembele’s calibre would represent a significant boost. His experience at the highest level and his proven ability to perform in decisive matches align with their ambitions. However, any move would require careful financial planning.
Possible implications for Arsenal
To fund a potential transfer, Arsenal may need to generate resources through player sales. Gabriel Jesus and Gabriel Martinelli have both been linked with moves away, which could provide flexibility should the club decide to pursue Dembele seriously. While no deal is imminent, the situation highlights how quickly circumstances can change in the transfer market.
If dissatisfaction at PSG continues, Arsenal could find themselves well placed to act, provided they balance ambition with sustainability.
